HDG.FS.content: acc. Heidegger, “categorial intuition” focal point of Husserlian thought > ground of sensuous what Husserl calls hyle, that which affects sensibly, the sense data (blue, black, spatial extension) > along w/ sense data comes the object: object can’t be perceived sensibly (fact that object is object doesn’t arise from sensuous intuition)

HDG.FS.content: Husserl attempts to articulate what Kant simply characterizes as concept of form: thus the given (Gegebenen) of intuition, categorial intuition, category more than a form > categorial as given

HDG.FS.content: Husserlian idea of “surplus (Überschusses)”: the “is” through which I observe object/substance is a “surplus” re: sensuous affections > categorial just as given as sensuous, thus CATEGORIAL INTUITION > Husserl teaches CI by way of analogy (a measure for correspondence): categorial corresponds to sense data (which is the measure of the analogy)

HDG.FS.content: for Husserl, the categorial, the forms, the “is” can be encountered (whereas, for Kant, they’re just deduced from table of judgment), the fact (Tatsache) of the category can be encountered (vorfinden)

HDG.FS.content: for Husserl, substantiality [categorial?], non-appearance, (of book), enables what appears to appear, more apparent that what itself appears > w/ categorial intution, Husserl freed being from its attachment to judgment reorients entire field of investigation > if Heidegger poses question of meaning of being, must already be beyond being, understood as being of beings [Befragte: Being; das Erfragte: meaning of Being]

HDG.FS.content: to unfold question of meaning of Being, Being must be given > Husserl succeeded in this making present of Being, phenomenally present in category > Husserl gave Heidegger ground: “being” no mere concept, no pure abstraction > Husserl doesn’t inquire forth into Being after reaching Being as given, doesn’t ask what it means > no question for Husserl, “being” means being-object (but objectivity is a mode of presence)

HDG.FS.content: subjectivity itself not questioned re: its being > since Descartes, subjectivity is fundamentum inconcussum, the barrier to unfolding Seinsfrage ——the “making-present-to-oneself (Selbstvergegenwärtigung)” of consciousness takes place in immanence, what I am conscious of is present to me, in my consciousness > in Being and Time, “thing” no longer in consciousness, but in the world > despite intentionality, Husserl remains trapped in immanence: Husserl retrieves proper consistency of object, saves object, but by situating it in immanence of consciousness

HDG.OHF.content: [bracketing of phenomenology—deconstruction of Heidegger’s destruction?] Husserl’s phenomenology: “where are the objects about which logic speaks and how are they for it?” > Brentano characterized consciousness as intentionality, a concept that arose in Middle Ages, though it had narrower meaning then: volitional being-out-for-something and going-toward-it (das willentliche Aussein auf etwas) (orexis)

HDG.OHF.content: Husserl’s object didn’t change, but the how of interrogating/defining it did, question of access (Zugangsfrage): a descriptive method (not a constructivist one) > “phenomenon” not primarily a category, but deals w/ how of access/grasping/safekeeping (Verwahrung), phenomenology (initially) nothing more than mode of research/inquiry (Weise der Forschung): “addressing (Ansprechen) something just as it shows (zeigt) itself and only to the extent that it shows itself”

HDG.OHF.content: [but] Husserl also held ideal of science, found it prescribed in mathematics: attempted to elevate description to mathematical rigor > mathematics is least rigorous of disciplines: easiest to gain access to [?]

HDG.OHF.content: to bring mathematics to play as model (Vorbildes) for all scientific disciplines is unphenomenological: meaning of rigor must be drawn from kind of object being questioned & mode of access appropriate to it (angemessenen Zugangsart) [Heidegger beyond Husserl]

HDG.OHF.content: since Parmenides [does his reading of Parmenides change?], “perceptual mean-ing (vernehmendes Vermeinen)” and Being are the same [noien and einai], 1st fundamental insight (Grundeinsicht) of idealism (traditional ontology/logic stand w/in the fate of Parmenidean interpretation) (no accident Husserl still characterizing intentionality as “noetic”) > recovering (Gewinnung) a primordial situation presupposes critique of development of intellectual history
